sub_topic: Finding the maximum or minimum value of a trigonometric function
message_1: A Ferris wheel has a radius of 20 meters and completes one full revolution in 60 seconds. What is the maximum height above the ground reached by a passenger if they start at the bottom of the Ferris wheel ride?
message_2:
The maximum height above the ground reached by a passenger on a Ferris wheel can be found by adding the radius of the wheel to the distance from the ground to the center of the wheel. Since the Ferris wheel has a radius of 20 meters, and the center of the wheel is also 20 meters above the ground, the maximum height a passenger will reach is:

20 meters (radius) + 20 meters (distance from ground to center) = 40 meters

So, the maximum height above the ground reached by a passenger is 40 meters.
